intro: Calyptranthera brevicaudata, commonly known as the short-tailed calyptranthera, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Calyptranthera brevicaudata is often found growing in shaded, moist environments along streambanks and in understorey vegetation.
